subtitle: 1 missed period
title: How do I know I’m pregnant?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Are you pregnant? How can you tell? The surest sign is a missed period, but you may find it hard to remember the date of your last period.

Do you have any of these signs of pregnancy?

 - Your breasts look and feel different 
 - You notice some spots of blood in your underwear 
 - You feel nauseous
 - You need to pass urine more than usual 
 - You miss a period

If you think you are pregnant, it is best if you see a midwife (bidan). The earlier you find out, the sooner you can start planning for your new baby. A bidan will also be able to give you advice and help while you are pregnant.

The bidan will weigh you, check your blood pressure and test your urine. 

Worried about seeing a bidan? Ask a friend to go with you.
